channel.title: FLashing my xbox
channel.description: hey guys, iv been looking around the inet for some good tuts on how to flash your xbox, iv seen a few but there all shit, and don't really help you out. Not to sure what drive iv got, iv forgot since i done the RROD, ill take alook when iv found a good tut. also iv downloaded a few games from torrents and was wondering is it just as simple as mounting the iso onto the DL disk? i here you have to patch them or something?

item.title: FLashing my xbox
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

hey, thanks newbiehacker, i went to open my xbox today but couldn’t find the right size torx bit, ill take alook at the links you gave me in the next few days when i get a chance, ill hopefully do it sometime over the weekend. ill keep this place updated

[EDIT]

flashed it a few days ago, got some games burned off and there working like a charm thanks for your help guys!

Read full topic

item.title: FLashing my xbox
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

N00b1:

hey guys, iv been looking around the inet for some good tuts on how to flash your xbox, iv seen a few but there all shit, and don’t really help you out. Not to sure what drive iv got, iv forgot since i done the RROD, ill take alook when iv found a good tut. also iv downloaded a few games from torrents and was wondering is it just as simple as mounting the iso onto the DL disk? i here you have to patch them or something?

Flashing is difficult depending on the drive model, liteons require a special tool in order to get them to work properly (unless you’re really good with a fine-tipped soldering iron). Jungle flasher has all the tools you need to mod your drive and there’s plenty of tutorials on the internet.

As for burning games, it’s recommended you check them all with abgx360 before going anywhere near your xbox with it, this will check the DMI, PFI, video partition and stealth sectors to make sure your game rip is valid. Then it’s simply a case of inserting a blank dual layer dvd, running imgburn and loading the dvd file (NOT the iso file).

Links
[table]
[tr]
[td]JungleFlasher[/td]
[td]http://www.jungleflasher.net/[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Firmware (and support)[/td]
[td]http://www.ixtreme.net/[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]abgx360[/td]
[td]http://www.abgx360.net/ [/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]ImgBurn[/td]
[td]http://www.imgburn.com/ [/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

Read full topic

item.title: FLashing my xbox
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

You dont even have to open up the xbox… Just open the tray… You better hope that you get a BenQ as that has the new firmware for it and its pretty easy to get the key and flash.

Read full topic

Tico:

I think newbiehacker has a pretty good idea on how to do that.

just sent him a pm, thanks for the info.

umm what you up to noob?

GTFO…
[/quote]Lel… This for identifying your DVD drive. I think that the Jungleflasher tut is the best as it covers all of the flashing for different drives. http://www.megaupload.com/?d=IF91SN2M[/quote]

thanks, ill know what drive i have soon as i open the xbox up so im good there. im going to take a look at that pdf now.
